qas.question: Who did some early Dominican followers have trouble reconciling?
Where was one female Dominican house located?
How many female Dominican houses were there in Germany?
Who were an order of religious women who later converted to Dominican?
How many Dominican nunneries were there by 1358?
Who did some early Dominican followers not have trouble reconciling?

plausible_answers.text: about the necessity of female religious establishments in an order whose major purpose was preaching

qas.question: What did some of the brethren not have issues with?
Where in England was one female Dominican house located?
What dotted the countryside throughout Asia?
How many female Benedictine houses  were in France?

context: Although Dominic and the early brethren had instituted <a0_0><b5_0>female Dominican houses<b5_0/><a0_0/> at <a1_0><b7_0>Prouille<b7_0/><a1_0/> and other places by 1227, some of the brethren of the order had misgivings <b6_0>about the necessity of female religious establishments in an order whose major purpose was preaching<b6_0/>, a duty in which women could not traditionally engage. In spite of these doubts, <b8_0>women's houses<b8_0/> dotted the countryside throughout Europe. There were <a2_0>seventy-four<a2_0/> Dominican female houses in Germany, forty-two in Italy, <b9_0>nine<b9_0/> in France, eight in Spain, six in Bohemia, three in Hungary, and three in Poland. Many of the German religious houses that lodged women had been home to communities of women, such as <a3_0>Beguines<a3_0/>, that became Dominican once they were taught by the traveling preachers and put under the jurisdiction of the Dominican authoritative structure. A number of these houses became centers of study and mystical spirituality in the 14th century. There were <a4_0>one hundred and fifty-seven<a4_0/> nunneries in the order by 1358. In that year, the number lessened due to disasters like the Black Death.
